intro: Manihot crotalariiformis, commonly known as the yellow arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
